I had a very solemn message and it made a decided impression on the many assembled. Several followed me out to the carriage to speak a word with me. Professor Ramsey came to the carriage and spoke with me. Seemed very glad he heard me again. He has fullness of flesh but his countenance is greatly changed in expression. There was not that intelligence and refinement that had once been there, and I felt sorry.--Letter 390, 1904. 





Ellen G. White Estate 
Silver Spring, Maryland 
May 9, 1991. Entire Letter.
